com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection
Class DebugDetector

java.lang.Object
  com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection.DebugDetector

public class DebugDetector
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides a set of static methods enabling the detection of various debug related application states. The use of debuggers is common practice when attacking an application.

A debuggable application is one which is marked as such in its meta-data (e.g. the application manifest). This does not indicate anything except the fact one could easily attach a debugger. Some attacks consist of re-enabling this state on your released application in order to attach a debugger.

A debugger actually being connected to your application outside of your development team could indicate a great threat. We use a set of techniques trying to detect this, all of which are wrapped with the simple isDebuggerConnected() methods.

Applications signed with a debug key after a release are probably being repackaged. Attackers repackage applications after making changes enabling them to alter behaviour, attach debuggers,... Our check helps detect this.
